page.title: 11The D.V.L.C.
page.content: D.V.L.C. stands for Driver and Vehicle Licensing Centre. It is very important to people who own cars. About Five thousand people are employed at the D.V.L.C. which was opened about fifteen years ago.Their work includes keeping records of all the drivers in the country and issuing registration documents and driving licenses. The records are kept on a great big computer so if someone's car is stolen the police can check with the computer to find the owner. The D.V.L.C. has sixteen floors and it is one of the tallest buildings in Swansea. At night its lights can be seen shining brightly for miles around. When someone begins working at the centre they have to sign a form. When they have signed the form they must not tell anyone about their work
